intro: Tounatea alterna, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Tounatea alterna is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
